segment.source: Use the Windows Store analytics API to programmatically retrieve analytics data for apps that are registered to your or your organization''s Windows Dev Center account.
segment.target: Use the Windows Store analytics API to programmatically retrieve analytics data for apps that are registered to your or your organization''s Windows Dev Center account.

segment.source: Access analytics data using Windows Store services
segment.target: Access analytics data using Windows Store services

segment.source: Access analytics data using Windows Store services
segment.target: Access analytics data using Windows Store services

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Use the Windows Store analytics API to programmatically retrieve analytics data for apps that are registered to your or your organization's Windows Dev Center account.
segment.target: Use the Windows Store analytics API to programmatically retrieve analytics data for apps that are registered to your or your organization's Windows Dev Center account.

segment.source: This API enables you to retrieve data for app and IAP acquisitions, errors, app ratings and reviews.
segment.target: This API enables you to retrieve data for app and IAP acquisitions, errors, app ratings and reviews.

segment.source: This API uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to authenticate the calls from your app or service.
segment.target: This API uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to authenticate the calls from your app or service.

segment.source: Prerequisites for using the Windows Store analytics API
segment.target: Prerequisites for using the Windows Store analytics API

segment.source: You (or your organization) must have an Azure AD directory.
segment.target: You (or your organization) must have an Azure AD directory.

segment.source: If you already use Office 365 or other business services from Microsoft, you already have Azure AD directory.
segment.target: If you already use Office 365 or other business services from Microsoft, you already have Azure AD directory.

segment.source: Otherwise, you can get one for free.
segment.target: Otherwise, you can get one for free.

segment.source: You must have a user account in the Azure AD directory that you want to associate with your Windows Dev Center account.
segment.target: You must have a user account in the Azure AD directory that you want to associate with your Windows Dev Center account.

segment.source: Using the Windows Store analytics API
segment.target: Using the Windows Store analytics API

segment.source: Before you can use the Windows Store analytics API, you must associate an Azure AD application with your Dev Center account and obtain an Azure AD access token.
segment.target: Before you can use the Windows Store analytics API, you must associate an Azure AD application with your Dev Center account and obtain an Azure AD access token.

segment.source: The Azure AD application represents the app or service from which you want to call the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: The Azure AD application represents the app or service from which you want to call the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: After you have an access token, you can call the Windows Store analytics API from your app or service.
segment.target: After you have an access token, you can call the Windows Store analytics API from your app or service.

segment.source: The following steps describe the end-to-end process:
segment.target: The following steps describe the end-to-end process:

segment.source: Associate an Azure AD application with your Windows Dev Center account.
segment.target: Associate an Azure AD application with your Windows Dev Center account.

segment.source: Obtain an Azure AD access token.
segment.target: Obtain an Azure AD access token.

segment.source: Call the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: Call the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: Associate an Azure AD application with your Windows Dev Center account
segment.target: Associate an Azure AD application with your Windows Dev Center account

segment.source: In Dev Center, go to your Account settings, click Manage users, and associate your organization's Dev Center account with your organization's Azure AD directory.
segment.target: In Dev Center, go to your Account settings, click Manage users, and associate your organization's Dev Center account with your organization's Azure AD directory.

segment.source: For detailed instructions, see Manage account users.
segment.target: For detailed instructions, see Manage account users.

segment.source: You can optionally add other users from your organization's Azure AD directory so they can also access the Dev Center account.
segment.target: You can optionally add other users from your organization's Azure AD directory so they can also access the Dev Center account.

segment.source: Note Only one Dev Center account can be associated with an Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: Note Only one Dev Center account can be associated with an Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: Similarly, only one Azure Active Directory can be associated with a Dev Center account.
segment.target: Similarly, only one Azure Active Directory can be associated with a Dev Center account.

segment.source: After you establish this association, you won't be able to remove it without contacting support.
segment.target: After you establish this association, you won't be able to remove it without contacting support.

segment.source: In the Manage users page, click Add Azure AD applications, add the Azure AD application that represents the app or service that you will use to access analytics data for your Dev Center account, and assign it the Manager role.
segment.target: In the Manage users page, click Add Azure AD applications, add the Azure AD application that represents the app or service that you will use to access analytics data for your Dev Center account, and assign it the Manager role.

segment.source: If this application already exists in your Azure AD directory, you can select it on the Add Azure AD applications page to add it to your Dev Center account.
segment.target: If this application already exists in your Azure AD directory, you can select it on the Add Azure AD applications page to add it to your Dev Center account.

segment.source: Otherwise, you can create a new Azure AD application on the Add Azure AD applications page.
segment.target: Otherwise, you can create a new Azure AD application on the Add Azure AD applications page.

segment.source: For more information, see the section about managing Azure AD applications in Manage account users.
segment.target: For more information, see the section about managing Azure AD applications in Manage account users.

segment.source: Return to the Manage users page, click the name of your Azure AD application to go to the application settings, and click Add new key.
segment.target: Return to the Manage users page, click the name of your Azure AD application to go to the application settings, and click Add new key.

segment.source: On the following screen, copy down the Client ID and Key values.
segment.target: On the following screen, copy down the Client ID and Key values.

segment.source: For more information, see the section about managing Azure AD applications in Manage account users.
segment.target: For more information, see the section about managing Azure AD applications in Manage account users.

segment.source: You need these the client ID and key to obtain an Azure AD access token to use when calling the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: You need these the client ID and key to obtain an Azure AD access token to use when calling the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: You won't be able to access this info again after you leave this page.
segment.target: You won't be able to access this info again after you leave this page.

segment.source: Obtain an Azure AD access token
segment.target: Obtain an Azure AD access token

segment.source: After you associate an Azure AD application with your Dev Center account and you retrieve the client ID and key for the application, you can use this info to obtain an Azure AD access token.
segment.target: After you associate an Azure AD application with your Dev Center account and you retrieve the client ID and key for the application, you can use this info to obtain an Azure AD access token.

segment.source: You need an access token before you can call any of the methods in the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: You need an access token before you can call any of the methods in the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: After you create an access token, you have 60 minutes to use it before it expires.
segment.target: After you create an access token, you have 60 minutes to use it before it expires.

segment.source: To obtain the access token, follow the instructions in Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials to send an HTTP POST to the following Azure AD endpoint.
segment.target: To obtain the access token, follow the instructions in Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials to send an HTTP POST to the following Azure AD endpoint.

segment.source: To get your tenant ID, log in to the Azure Management Portal, navigate to Active Directory, and click the directory that you linked to your Dev Center account.
segment.target: To get your tenant ID, log in to the Azure Management Portal, navigate to Active Directory, and click the directory that you linked to your Dev Center account.

segment.source: The tenant ID for this directory is embedded in the URL for this page, as shown by the yourtenantID string in the example below.
segment.target: The tenant ID for this directory is embedded in the URL for this page, as shown by the yourtenantID string in the example below.

segment.source: For the clientid and clientsecret parameters, specify the client ID and the key for your application that you retrieved earlier from Dev Center.
segment.target: For the clientid and clientsecret parameters, specify the client ID and the key for your application that you retrieved earlier from Dev Center.

segment.source: For the resource parameter, specify the following URI: .
segment.target: For the resource parameter, specify the following URI: .

segment.source: Call the Windows Store analytics API
segment.target: Call the Windows Store analytics API

segment.source: After you have an Azure AD access token, you are ready to call the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: After you have an Azure AD access token, you are ready to call the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: For information about the syntax of each method, see the following articles.
segment.target: For information about the syntax of each method, see the following articles.

segment.source: You must pass the access token to the Authorization header of each method.
segment.target: You must pass the access token to the Authorization header of each method.

segment.source: Get app acquisitions
segment.target: Get app acquisitions

segment.source: Get IAP acquisitions
segment.target: Get IAP acquisitions

segment.source: Get error reporting data
segment.target: Get error reporting data

segment.source: Get app ratings
segment.target: Get app ratings

segment.source: Get app reviews
segment.target: Get app reviews

segment.source: Code example
segment.target: Code example

segment.source: The following code example demonstrates how to obtain an Azure AD access token and call the Windows Store analytics API from a C# console app.
segment.target: The following code example demonstrates how to obtain an Azure AD access token and call the Windows Store analytics API from a C# console app.

segment.source: To use this code example, assign the tenantId, clientId, clientSecret, and appID variables to the appropriate values for your scenario.
segment.target: To use this code example, assign the tenantId, clientId, clientSecret, and appID variables to the appropriate values for your scenario.

segment.source: This example requires the Json.NET package from Newtonsoft to deserialize the JSON data returned by the Windows Store analytics API.
segment.target: This example requires the Json.NET package from Newtonsoft to deserialize the JSON data returned by the Windows Store analytics API.

segment.source: Error responses
segment.target: Error responses

segment.source: The Windows Store analytics API returns error responses in a JSON object that contains error codes and messages.
segment.target: The Windows Store analytics API returns error responses in a JSON object that contains error codes and messages.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates an error response caused by an invalid parameter.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates an error response caused by an invalid parameter.
